title: 1960s TV Spy Shows
description: The Cold War era inspired a wave of thrilling spy shows on television. How well do you remember the secret agents of the 1960s?

questions.question: On 'The Man from U.N.C.L.E.', what did U.N.C.L.E. stand for?
options: Underground Network of Criminal Law Enforcement
United National Committee for Law Enforcement
United Nations Command for Law and Espionage
United Network Command for Law Enforcement

questions.question: Who played Napoleon Solo on 'The Man from U.N.C.L.E.'?
On 'Get Smart', what was the name of the evil organization that CONTROL fought against?
Who played the bumbling secret agent Maxwell Smart on 'Get Smart'?
What unusual device did Maxwell Smart use as a telephone on 'Get Smart'?
Which show featured a team of agents who received their assignments on a self-destructing tape?
Who played Illya Kuryakin, the Russian agent, on 'The Man from U.N.C.L.E.'?
What was Maxwell Smart's agent number on 'Get Smart'?
Which spy show starred Patrick McGoohan as secret agent John Drake?
On 'Mission: Impossible', who led the Impossible Missions Force in the original series?
Which actress played Agent 99 on 'Get Smart'?
What famous catchphrase did Maxwell Smart use when caught in an obvious lie?
Which British spy series featured the stylish team of John Steed and Emma Peel?
Who played the suave John Steed on 'The Avengers'?
Which surreal 1960s show featured a former spy trapped in a mysterious village and known only as 'Number Six'?
